Events that occurred on 10 March

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1937 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 11b.
1950 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letters 125 and 126.
1950 - Stephen Oliver is born.
1963 - Voice actor Steve Staley is born.
1981 - Amon Hen 49 is published.
2004 - "Siege of Gondor", the eighth set in The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game is released.
2007 - "The One Ring Celebration 2007" in Burbank, California.
2008 - The Lord of the Rings is elected "Best Foreign Book of All Time" in the Netherlands.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 2510:
Borondir and his companion depart from Minas Tirith in search of the Éothéod.
T.A. 3019:
The Great Signal.
The Dawnless Day.
Frodo, Sam and Gollum pass the Cross-roads, and see the Morgul-host set forth, towards Minas Tirith.
The Muster of Rohan takes place. The Rohirrim ride from Harrowdale.
Faramir is rescued by Gandalf from the Nazgûl outside the gates of the City. He meets Pippin and reports to Denethor.
Aragorn, leading the Dead Men and the Grey Company, crosses the river Ringló.
An army of Orcs from the Morannon takes Cair Andros and passes into Anórien.
